title: Asian stocks dip, gold hits record as tariff woes return
summary: Markets reacted negatively as US President Donald Trump proposed new tariffs on eight European nations. This move revived tariff concerns, causing risk assets to slip and safe-haven demand to strengthen. Gold and silver prices surged to record highs. Equity futures slumped, and the dollar weakened.

title: What Tiger Global ruling means for foreign investors
summary: A Supreme Court ruling impacts foreign investors in India. Investors can no longer use only a Tax Residency Certificate for tax benefits. Tax authorities will now examine the business substance of overseas investment structures. This affects private equity and other foreign portfolio investors, particularly those using Mauritius and Singapore.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian equity markets closed marginally higher on Friday, buoyed by positive sentiment in the IT and banking sectors. Analysts anticipate a sideways trading range in the near term, with stock-specific movements driven by earnings and trade developments. Geopolitical escalations remain a key risk factor.

title: Stocks in news: RIL, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, Bharat Coking Coal, Tata Technologies, Wipro
summary: Indian markets ended marginally higher, extending their consolidation phase. Investors await key Q3 earnings from Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank, and ICICI Bank for directional cues. Analysts advise a selective, stock-specific approach, focusing on IT, financials, and metals amid volatility.

title: China's tech stock boom pushes past economic malaise
summary: China's tech sector is experiencing a significant rally in early 2026, driven by advancements in AI, commercial rockets, robotics, and flying cars. This surge in homegrown technologies is outperforming global benchmarks, fueled by investor optimism about China's ambition to lead in AI and high-level chips, even amidst economic fragilities.

title: Nifty needs 25,900 break for fresh upside amid volatility: Analysts
summary: Indian markets are experiencing indecision and rising volatility. Analysts highlight key levels for Nifty. A close above 25,900 could boost the index towards 26,300. Conversely, a break below 25,500 may signal further declines. Traders are advised to await clear direction. Top stock picks include Canara Bank, Tech Mahindra, Rail Vikas Nigam, Bank of India, and Ultratech Cement.

title: Stock Radar: JSW Energy breaks out from inverse head & shoulder pattern; time to buy?
summary: JSW Energy's stock has broken out of an inverse head and shoulder pattern on daily charts, trading above the neckline despite a recent dip. Experts suggest buying now or on dips for a target of 500-550 in the coming weeks, citing a bullish technical signal and strong support.

title: Sun Pharma looks to rise in US with $10 billion Organon buy
summary: India's largest drugmaker, Sun Pharma, is considering a major acquisition. The company is evaluating the purchase of US-based Organon, a specialist in women's health. This potential deal is valued at around $10 billion. A successful acquisition would be a significant move for Sun Pharma, strengthening its presence in the US market.

title: Priority sector lending: RBI asks HDFC, ICICI banks to make extra provisions
summary: ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank have been instructed by a regulator to make significant one-time provisions. ICICI Bank must set aside an additional Rs 1,283 crore, while HDFC Bank is required to allocate Rs 500 crore. The regulator has also urged both banks to identify and address shortcomings in their loan portfolios. These adjustments are necessary to ensure compliance with Priority Sector Lending (PSL) norms.

title: India needs to narrow the insurance protection gap: Swiss Re
summary: India's total property exposure is now estimated at $26-29 trillion, according to a global reinsurer. A significant portion of this exposure is located in areas prone to natural disasters. These regions are characterized by a high concentration of economic assets that coincide with risks such as floods, cyclones, and earthquakes.

title: Cutting risk cuts microfin's portfolio, recovery way off
summary: Microfinance loan portfolios have been declining since April 2024, according to industry leaders. This trend began after reaching a high of Rs 3.43 lakh crore. The decrease is attributed to loan repayments exceeding new loan disbursements across the sector.

summary: Bharat Coking Coal IPO listing date is today 19 January 2026. Ahead of the share debut, Bharat Coking Coal IPO GMP today and analysts expect listing to be at a strong premium over the issue price.

title: Markets with Bertie: Bertie goes to China, explores fast vs slow returns
summary: Bertie visited Shanghai for a conference, noting China's cashless economy, tech advancements. Talks with fellow fund managers highlighted contrasts between investing in the 2 nations, emphasizing China's competitive intensity and the challenges newcomers face in India's bureaucratic landscape.

title: Stocks to buy: Raja Venkatraman recommends top picks for 19 January
summary: Market expert Raja Venkatraman shares his top stocks to buy today, 19 January. Discover his exclusive picks and analysis to inform your investment strategy.

title: Reliance Industries: Is FMCG the next big bet?
summary: RIL's Q3FY26 results were flat, with net profit at  ₹18,645 crore. Despite a 50% jump in Singapore GRMs, O2C growth was stifled by petchem weakness. With Jio and Retail listings imminent, the newly separated FMCG business RCPL is being positioned as a major valuation driver.

title: Gold and Silver Hit Record Highs on Greenland Tariff Threats
summary: Gold and silver hit record highs after US President Donald Trump said he would slap tariffs on eight European nations that have opposed his plan to take Greenland.

summary: ANMI national president requests Sebi to extend equity-style incentives to commodity derivatives segment for deepening markets. Will it help reduce dominance in CDS?

title: China’s $7 Trillion Cash Pile Is Shifting Into Stocks, Gold
summary: Chinese households are scouring for higher-yielding investments as roughly $7 trillion in time deposits come due this year, a shift that could provide additional fuel for the nation’s financial markets.

title: Being an authority as a travel partner key to trust for visa: Atlys’ Santosh Hegde
summary: Atlys was in the news for offering visas for just  ₹1 in August. Indians are traveling abroad more than ever, but getting a visa is still not straightforward. Atlys is using social media, building its own channels, and relying on travel influencers to keep itself relevant to jetsetting Indians.&nbsp;

title: A penalty and a warning later, haze persists over IndiGo pilot hirings
summary: Questions remain over whether IndiGo can realistically induct enough pilots to meet India’s staffing and flight duty norms, according to consultants and pilots.

title: How HCLTech defied the gravity of India's four-year IT slump
summary: Out of India's top five IT stocks, only one pulled ahead in the last four years: HCL Technologies. The others either had nil returns, or even lost value. What made the Noida-based company stand out?

title: Distrust Reigns as ‘Me’ Supplants ‘We’ in Edelman Pre-Davos Poll
summary: People across the world are becoming ever warier of governments and institutions as geopolitical tensions fuel nationalism and economic anxieties mount, according to communications firm Edelman.

title: Should I rebalance my portfolio?
summary: An investor with a 5-6 year Systematic Investment Plan history in mid- and small-cap funds seeks advice on whether to move profits into large-cap or hybrid funds, and the expert recommends a hybrid approach.
